currentLocation.dldescription: Location identifier for the animal using a URN-based identification string containing namespace and unique identifier within the namespace

currentStatus.dldescription: Typically describes if the animal is Alive, Dead or in Transit. Also known as 'Status' in some systems. Reason for Fate should be captured as an observation

disposalMethod.dldescription: Describes the disposal method for an animal that is dead. It can take the values - Home Kill, Disposed at NAIT Location, Meat processor-human consumption, Meat Prociessor-pet food, Rendering Facility

fertilityStatus.dldescription: Indicates whether an animal is known to be fertile or note, or whether it has been partly or fully neutered. For instance, a neutered cattle male is a steer, a neutered sheep male is a wether. Females of both species can be spayed. An infertile male by comparison still has testes and responds as a male, and is frequently used as a 'teaser'

lactating.dldescription: Confirms whether an animal is lactating at time of data transfer. Note this may change many times over an animal's life. It can take the values True or False

reproductiveStatus.dldescription: Describes if the animal is pregnant at the time of data transfer. Note this may change many times over an animal's life. It can take the values - NULL, Cycling, Not Cycling, Pregnant, Involuting

statusDate.dldescription: Date the fate or status last changed

withholdingDateExport.dldescription: Describes the date resulting from export slaughter interval of a treatment. May be NULL

withholdingDateMeat.dldescription: Describes the date before which an animal may not enter the food supply chain. May be NULL

withholdingDateMilk.dldescription: Describes the date before which an animal may not enter the food supply chain. May be NULL
